fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Budget, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Migration and asylum
eu_initiatives: Major pan-European financial instruments, and in particular, Horizon (Horizon Europe)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit: Åbo Akademi University (ÅAU) in Turku, Finland, is an internationally acknowledged research university with an extensive responsibility for preserving the Swedish educational and cultural heritage as the only Swedish-speaking multidisciplinary university in Finland. The recent adoption and further development of the four strategic research areas (Minority Studies, Molecular Process and Material Technology, Drug Development and Diagnostics, and the Sea profile), has allowed ÅAU to focus on major national and European projects, as well as reinforce its status as a bridge between Finland and other Nordic states, advancing scientific collaboration in a variety of highly relevant research areas.
relevant_communication: There has been a series of events designed to promote ÅAU at the local/ national/ regional level.  ÅAU strives to strengthen its ties within the EU (academic institutions,  commercial companies, NGOs and public institutions) in order to promote excellent science and develop R&I.
